intro: Senecio eximius, commonly known as the Blueweed, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky, arid environments and has a compact, bushy appearance. Its blue to violet flowers bloom in late summer, attracting various pollinators. Senecio eximius is also valued for its ornamental appeal and is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
